lv.emes.libraries.tools.lists

Class MS_RandomItemList

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.tools.lists.MS_RandomItemList

  • public class MS_RandomItemList
extends java.lang.Object
    Random item list is like bag where you can put different items which are identified as integers.
    The list has a size. The bigger size is, the more items will be stored with method storeItem, for example, by storing "carrots" with probability 20% in list of 50 items you actually will store 10 carrots so when trying to getItem from the list there will be small chance to get a carrot, because there will be 40 empty values in the list.
    Purpose of this kind of list is to fill it with different kind of items that could be found with some probability.

    Public methods: -storeItem -getItem -shuffle

    Version:
    1.0.
    See Also:
    MSRandomItemListExample

    • Constructor Detail

      • MS_RandomItemList

        public MS_RandomItemList(int listSize)
        Creates random item list if size listSize which means that maximum count of items in this list can be listSize.
        The bigger listSize is provided, the bigger will be random's precision.
        Parameters:
        listSize - size of list (recommended 100..1000 regarding of count of different items).

    • Method Detail

      • storeItem

        public void storeItem(int item,
                      float probability)
               throws MS_RandomItemList.IncorrectProbabilityException,
                      MS_RandomItemList.NoMoreFreeSpacesException,
                      MS_RandomItemList.ItemTookLastSpacesException
        Stores an item to the random item list.

        Actually exceptions shouldn't appear if programmer did calculations correctly.

        Parameters:
        item - id of an item or simply number to recognize item through many items.
        probability - chance of getting an item from the list.
        Throws:
        MS_RandomItemList.IncorrectProbabilityException - when not 0 < probability <= 1.
        MS_RandomItemList.NoMoreFreeSpacesException - when list is already full.
        MS_RandomItemList.ItemTookLastSpacesException - when list was almost full and last item had too big probability to add item fully.
